p: The Cu is potentiostatically deposited on PEDOT in 0.1 M NaClO 4 containing 2 mM of CuSO 4 at an applied potential +0.34 V vs. SHE for a period of 120 s by using chronoamperometric (CA) technique. An abrupt increase in current density value is noticed at the initial stage which attained a steady state around 2 s, indicating the nucleation and followed by uniform growth of Cu on PEDOT.
